707547f-a.text:
(1)
First Ave., east side, north from East 25th Street, and showing Bellevue Hospital. Prominent building shown at the N.E. Corner of
East 26th Street, is the Out Patient Department.
April 27, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date. Note demolition of the former Carl H. Schultn Mineral Water Plant. Building under construction, will
provide new medical wards.
May 23, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same as No. 2, slightly more inclusive southward.
May 23, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

711790f-b.text:
East 25th Street, south side, east from, but not including First Ave., to East River. The 6-story building just west of the river (Nos. 430-436) is the Municipal Lodging House.
May 23, 1936
P. L. Sperr

(2)
East 25th Street at the East River and showing Pier No. 73 East River. On the left appears a portion of the rear of the Training School for Nurses, Bellevue Hospital.
About 1932

711790f-a.text:
East 25th Street, south side, east from, but not including First Ave., to East River. The 6-story building just west of the river (Nos. 430-436) is the Municipal Lodging House.
May 23, 1936
P. L. Sperr

(2)
East 25th Street at the East River and showing Pier No. 73 East River. On the left appears a portion of the rear of the Training School for Nurses, Bellevue Hospital.
About 1932

707548f-a.text:
First Ave., east side, north from East 25th (right) to 26th Streets, showing a clearance upon the former site of the Carl Shultz Bottling Plant. On the right appears a view eastward on the north sido of East 25th Street, to the East River, at which point is Pier No. 73. Buildings
shown are units of Bellevue Hospital.
May 23, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

707549f-b.text:
(1)
First Ave., west side, from East 25th to 26th Streets, as seen from East 25th Street, and across clearance on the east side of First Ave. Shown at the S.W. corner of East 26th Street, is Bellevue Medical College.
May 25, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, as seen from East 26th Street.
May 25, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
The structures, No. 429 and 431 First Ave., and No. 341 East 25th Street forming a corner plot at 25th Street will be demolished and their site utilined for a new annex to Bellevue Medical College according to building plans filed as noted in the Times of April
22, 1938.

707549f-a.text:
(1)
First Ave., west side, from East 25th to 26th Streets, as seen from East 25th Street, and across clearance on the east side of First Ave. Shown at the S.W. corner of East 26th Street, is Bellevue Medical College.
May 25, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, as seen from East 26th Street.
May 25, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
The structures, No. 429 and 431 First Ave., and No. 341 East 25th Street forming a corner plot at 25th Street will be demolished and their site utilined for a new annex to Bellevue Medical College according to building plans filed as noted in the Times of April
22, 1938.

711791f-a.text:
East 25th Street, at, adjoining and east of the S.E. corner of First Ave. (right) as seen across clearance on the east side of First Avenue., between East 26th and 25th Streets.  On the right appears buildings on the west side of the Ave., south from East 24th to 23rd Streets and showing elevator loop at the later point.  Upon the clearance in the foreground was formerly the Carl Shultz Bottling Plant.

May 25, 1936.
P.L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

NEG. # 4475

711793f-a.text:
432-438 E 25th St, south side, east of 1st Ave, showing the 6-story Municipal Lodging House. the 2-story structure shown bears no number and is occupied by the Department of Water Supply, Gas and Electric. On the left is the Pier no. 73 East River, used by the City for the housing and feeding of poverty-stricken males.

Sept. 1937

707550f-a.text:
First Avenue, from East 25th (left of No. 1) to 27th Streets, as photographed from the J. J. Little & Ives plant on East 24th Street. The Avenue runs through the darkened foreground area. The parking lot occupies the entire east frontage of the 25th to 26th Street block. On the right is the Out Patient Department of Bellevue Hospital. In the background of View 1 is the Empire State Building. View 2 has the 42nd Street-Grand Central Zone for a backdrop.
October 13, 1939
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr

707550f-b.text:
First Avenue, from East 25th (left of No. 1) to 27th Streets, as photographed from the J. J. Little & Ives plant on East 24th Street. The Avenue runs through the darkened foreground area. The parking lot occupies the entire east frontage of the 25th to 26th Street block. On the right is the Out Patient Department of Bellevue Hospital. In the background of View 1 is the Empire State Building. View 2 has the 42nd Street-Grand Central Zone for a backdrop.
October 13, 1939
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr

707546f-a.text:
First Avenue, at the N. W. corner of East 25th Street, showing the newly erected Board of Health clinic. At the right is the adjoining Bellevue Medical College.
April 26, 1940
George D. Chinn
